page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN FRANKLEY
page.content: Those living in the older part own cars and can easily travel into the City to the many theatres,cinemas or restaurants.Via the M5 they can travel to other midland counties,Wales and even London in a few hours.Worcester, Warwick and Stratford are all great tourist attractions easily reached from Frankley;as indeed is most of the country using the Gravelly Hills Interchange("Spaghetti Junction")in Birmingham.Only about half of the families on the Frankley Est.own a car.Others use the bus to go to Rubery or Northfield shopping.Most use the train from Longbridge to travel to Birmingham.There used to be a railway running through the area.Many people feel it would be helpful to them to have such a line with a station in Frankley.
